title: [威士忌]藍角
content:

https://i.imgur.com/04ig7rn.jpg
Kakubin(角瓶) from Suntory company, probably is the best selling blended whisky in Asia. In Japan, they usually mix Kakubin with soda water, so called Kakubin-highball. 
Kakubin is blended with several Suntory whiskies like Yamazaki, Hakushu and Chita. They blended in different proportion, producing complete different flavours and styles. There are at least 4 Kakubin available nowadays, Original Kakubin, Kakubin in blue label, Kakubin in white label and Kakubin in black label.
.
As for this blue label Kakubin, which states they mature their whiskies in wine cask, sherry cask and, most amazing, mizunara(水梄木) cask, giving the spirits a rounded yet intense fruitiness and tannin impressions. Mixing with soda water, more maltiness stands out while nosing like a fresh apple cider. Delightful of grape and grassy note kicks in at the end. All of the Suntory whiskies show their character in a single drop, dancing harmonically yet balanced.
.
43% abv
Color: autumn amber
Nosing: more Yamazaki impression, Hakushu a little, sherry cask finish, wine cask finish, fruitiness of deep autumn harvests accompanied with hint of purple grape, rounded grain and malt harmonic blended
Palating: smooth, butterish yet balanced of grain and malt, corn or grain sweetness accompanied with maltiness synchronized perfectly, finish with mizunara woody and old temple inscense, feeling of zen and old monastery morning bell
Aftertaste medium, balanced, no characteristic, harmonized of Japanese craftsmanship
.
